direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods are fundamental to object comparison and have similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods involve checking the presence of a key in the map, though they return different types of results.
Both methods involve checking the presence of an element in the map, though they operate on different types of elements (keys vs. values).
Both methods involve operations on keys, though one checks for equality and the other retrieves a value.
Both methods involve operations on keys, though one checks for equality and the other removes the key-value pair.
Both methods involve operations on keys, though one checks for equality and the other adds or updates a key-value pair.
The equals method indirectly depends on the hash calculation for efficient bucket access, making it a relevant method for testing.
